sentences.english: Cuture study is becoming a manifest science in China.
sentences.chinese: 大众文化研究在我国越来越成为一门显学。

sentences.english: Therefore, China ancient times Wen Lun the research, in current became a famous doctrine.
sentences.chinese: 于是，中国古代文论的研究，在当前成为一门显学。

sentences.english: The Redology is one of famous social science in the Chinese cultural history of the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: “红学”是二十世纪中国文化史中的显学之一。

sentences.english: Mozis cultural ideology is a significant part of the outstanding Mohism.
sentences.chinese: 墨子的文化思想是先秦显学墨学的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Organizational Communication is one of the four major topics of the western communication theory family.
sentences.chinese: 组织传播是西方传播学家族中四大显学之一。

sentences.english: And in fact, the tendency of confucianism's turning to governance is irreversible.
sentences.chinese: 而事实是，儒学变成显学的趋势似不可逆转。

sentences.english: And in fact, the trend of Chinese classics craze is irreversible.
sentences.chinese: 而事实是，儒学变成显学的趋势似不可逆转。

definition: Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
New Confucianism, a social and political movement founded in 1920s China that combines aspects of Western and Eastern philosophy/see also 當代新儒家|当代新儒家[Dang1 dai4 Xin1 Ru2 jia1]
